events.name: Hack\'n Jill: Hacksgiving
events.about:
Join Hack'n Jill, NY Tech Meetup, Girl Develop It, and Control Group for a hackathon for social, global, and greater good. We'll address broken issues. We'll improve inefficient systems. We'll make the future better. Together.

Register on our HackerLeague Page to see who's coming and post your ideas.
SCHEDULE*

FRIDAY

7:00 PM – Registration, Pizza, and Beer**

7:30 PM – Kickoff and Introductions

8:00 PM – API Demos

9:00 PM – Ice Breakers and Team Formation

SATURDAY

8:00 AM   – Check-in and Breakfast

7:30 PM   – Pitches and Demos

10:00 PM – Announcement of Winners and Prize Distribution

11:00 PM – Post-Hack Party (offsite)**

 

*All times are subject to change*

**All attendees will require proper ID for alcohol consumption**

 Hack'n Jill reserves the right to manage attendees list to optimize for a 50:50 ratio of male to female attendees. 


IN COLLABORATION WITH:


                      

 

HOST:

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Brooklyn, USA
events.about:
Be part of the app revolution!

By registering, you’ll be joining thousands of developers worldwide as we build apps for the next generation of Windows.

Expert Help, Free Resources

Microsoft app experts, developers and trainers will be available on-site to assist your learning and coding. Learn about building Windows Store apps today – download the info, tools and resources you need now. 

Windows Azure Mobile Services

Does your Store app idea include cloud services or storage? Check out Get started withMobile Services –registered student WOWZAPP 2012 participants are eligible for a FREE student Windows Azure six-month subscription!– supplies are limited so be sure to register now!

events.name: BLIP Legal Hackathon
events.about:
The Inaugural BLIP Legal Hackathon will kick off on April 15, 2012.  Analogous to a true hackathon, participants will be challanged to use new technological tools to create new policy and law, and will discuss how technology can improve the law and society.  

The Hackathon is supported and in collaboration with:

  • BarBri
  • Docracy
  • Spindle Law
  • The Calyx Institute
  • Cmp.ly
  • Public Knowledge
